p: It has been previously speculated that historical reports would suggest previous circulation episodes of Chikungunya virus in the Americas [ 3]. The only documented introduction of the virus (Asian genotype) in the region occurred at the end of 2013 [ 2] and has been responsible for large outbreaks in the Caribbean islands, and numerous countries of Central and South-America. Moreover, 12 Floridian autochthonous cases [ 9] were reported in 2014.
